title: Analysis of Fed Rate Decision
content: Jerome Powell during a news conference following a Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) meeting in Washington in May. Photographer: Tierney L. Cross/Bloomberg

title: Caris Life Sciences Shares Climb After $494 Million IPO
content: Caris Life Sciences Inc. jumped as much as 40% after the health-care company raised $494 million in a US initial public offering that priced above the top of its marketed range.

title: Bridging Finance Executives Receive Fines, Bans in Ontario Fraud Case
content: David and Natasha Sharpe, the husband-and-wife team found to have committed fraud at private lender Bridging Finance Inc., were fined and ordered by Canada’s top securities regulator to repay more than C$20 million ($14.6 million).

title: European Gas Prices Fall as Trump Says Iran Seeks Negotiations
content: European natural gas fell after five sessions of gains as US President Donald Trump said Iran had reached out about the possibility of negotiations, bolstering speculation that the conflict with Israel could de-escalate.

title: Kellanova Slumps on Report EU Regulators to Probe Mars Deal
content: Kellanova shares fell in New York trading following a report from Reuters that European Union regulators are opening an investigation into Mars Inc.’s acquisition of the maker of Pop-Tarts and Eggo waffles.

title: Biggest US Oil Stockpile Drop in a Year Shows Tightening Market
content: US crude stockpiles declined the most in almost a year last week, signaling a tighter market for American oil just as the Israel-Iran conflict threatens supplies from the Middle East.

title: Stocks Rise After Trump Says Iran Has Reached Out: Markets Wrap
content: Wall Street traders fixated on the latest developments in the Middle East drove stocks higher after President Donald Trump said Iran has reached out about the possibility of negotiations, bolstering hopes Tehran’s conflict with Israel will de-escalate. Oil erased gains.

title: Spain Reveals Details of Chain Reaction That Caused Outage
content: Spain’s most-detailed account yet of the missteps leading to April’s nationwide blackout failed to fully explain why the power grid was so unstable in the first place.

title: ECB’s Panetta Says Economic Outlook Faces Substantial Risks
content: The euro-zone’s economic prospects face “substantial” dangers that officials are struggling to assess, according to European Central Bank Governing Council member Fabio Panetta.

title: Trump Is Driving Off Investors and Threatening the Dollar’s Reign
content: The president’s economic agenda is dragging down the dollar and making it more difficult for the US to finance its deficits.

title: Oil Falls in Turbulent Trading Amid Concerns War Will Escalate
content: Oil swung in a turbulent session amid speculation the US may join the Middle East conflict, with traders focused on flows through the region’s vital shipping chokepoint.

title: Mortgage Rates in US Fall for a Third Week, Slipping to 6.81%
content: Mortgage rates in the US dropped for a third week, sliding to the lowest level since the middle of May.

title: US Stocks Rise as Investors Await Federal Reserve Rate Decision
content: US stocks gained on Wednesday with investors looking ahead to the Federal Reserve’s monetary policy decision.

title: India Ends Expiry Day War of Bourses, Says No More Changes
content: India’s securities market regulator on Wednesday said that there would be no further changes to the derivatives expiry day, ending speculation that the bourses may again seek a shift at some point.

title: Globalive Bid for Wealth One Bank Wins Canada Approval
content: Freedom Mobile founder Anthony Lacavera’s investment firm won federal approval to acquire Wealth One Bank of Canada.

title: UK’s Reynolds Says Steel to Be Wrapped Into Wider US Trade Talks
content: The UK’s efforts to secure lower tariffs on steel exports to the US are likely to be wrapped into a future trade negotiations, according to Business Secretary Jonathan Reynolds, dampening expectations that such a deal is imminent.

title: AWS' Klein on AI Trends & Business Outlook
content: Olivier Klein, Chief APAC Technologist for AWS, discusses his outlook on how trends like Agentic AI is changing model structures and application of artificial intelligence for businesses in the region. He speaks with Annabelle Droulers on the sidelines of SuperAI Conference in Singapore on "The China Show". (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Mike Novogratz on a Shadow Fed, Markets, Stablecoin Bill
content: Billionaire Michael Novogratz, CEO of Galaxy Digital Holdings Ltd., says the idea of President Donald Trump nominating a shadow Federal Reserve Chair would be “not wise” and “very bad for the country.” He also discusses the potential impact of a large interest rate cut and the market implications of the US getting involved in the Israel-Iran conflict, and what the passage of the stablecoin bill means to his firm and the crypto market. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Bloomberg Surveillance 6/18/2025
content: Jonathan Ferro, Lisa Abramowicz and Annmarie Hordern speak daily with leaders and decision makers from Wall Street to Washington and beyond. No other program better positions investors and executives for the trading day. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Novogratz Sees Stablecoin Bill Bringing TradFi to Crypto
content: Billionaire Michael Novogratz, CEO of Galaxy Digital Holdings Ltd., expects to see tokenized equities “for crypto and non-crypto” as he discusses what the passage of landmark stablecoin legislation means for his firm and the cryptocurrency market.

title: Boston Transit Operator to Borrow $939 Million as Deficit Looms
content: The agency that runs the cash-strapped Boston subway system known as the T is borrowing to help fund transit upgrades.

title: France’s Economy Is Falling Behind as Europe Gradually Recovers
content: France’s economy is falling behind the rest of Europe with weakness across the board — just as uncertainty over budget cuts looks set to return, according to the statistics office.

title: Blackstone's James Expects More Deal Flow Amid Volatility
content: Chris James, Blackstone's head of tactical opportunities, discusses the outlook for deal flow amid heightened market volatility. He speaks on "Bloomberg Open Interest." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Novogratz Says Stablecoin Bill Will Push Traditional Finance Toward Crypto
content: Billionaire Michael Novogratz said that the passage of landmark stablecoin legislation will bring more traditional financial institutions into the cryptocurrency market.

title: It’s Not Cool To Be a Job Creator Right Now
content: What’s really going on with the labor market?

title: Houston’s Electric Utility Is Prepared for Storms After 2024 Blackout, CEO Says
content: Houston’s electric utility is confident significant grid investments will prevent a repeat of widespread blackouts that occurred last summer following Hurricane Beryl.

title: Trump Calls Powell 'Stupid,' Says He's Done a Poor Job at Fed
content: President Donald Trump criticizes Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell while talking with reporters on the White House lawn ahead of a flag raising. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Investors Are Torn Between Selling Equities or Buying the Dip
content: Stock exposure is high enough to cause a sharp risk-off move, yet light enough to spark a round of dip-buying, and all it would take is a single headline.

title: India SEBI Eases Rules for Global Funds Buying Sovereign Bonds
content: India’s securities market regulator on Wednesday relaxed certain rules for foreign funds investing in local government bonds, to increase participation from funds tracking global bond indexes.

title: Nippon Steel Closes $14.1 Billion Acquisition of US Steel
content: Nippon Steel Corp. closed its $14.1 billion takeover of United States Steel Corp., concluding an 18-month saga that became heavily politicized before the deal finally won US President Donald Trump’s support.

title: Pakistan Army Chief Set for Rare Meeting With US President
content: President Donald Trump is expected to meet Pakistan’s army chief for talks as the US considers supporting Israeli airstrikes on Iran, a country with a cooperative and complex relationship with the government in Islamabad.

title: Trump Again Pushes TikTok Sale Deadline With 90-Day Reprieve
content: President Donald Trump plans to extend for a third time the deadline for Chinese company ByteDance Ltd. to divest the American operations of TikTok, allowing the social media app to keep running in the US while negotiations proceed.

title: Supreme Court Upholds Curbs on Care for Transgender Minors
content: A divided US Supreme Court upheld a Tennessee law that outlaws certain controversial medical treatments for transgender children, preserving similar measures in two dozen states and dealing a fresh blow to LGBTQ rights.

title: Trump Says Iran Missed Chance for Deal, Vague on Strike Plans
content: President Donald Trump said Iran squandered the chance to make a deal over its nuclear enrichment, but declined to say whether the US plans to join Israel’s offensive aimed at destroying the program.

title: Trump Urges SALT Deal as Lawler Stands Firm on $40,000 Cap
content: President Donald Trump expressed optimism that lawmakers could reach a compromise on the state and local tax deduction — a sticking point in his “One Big Beautiful Bill” — even as a key SALT advocate insisted a deal had already been reached.

title: Modi Disputes Trump’s Version of India-Pakistan Ceasefire
content: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi disputed President Donald Trump’s claims that trade deals were used to clinch a recent ceasefire with Pakistan, the latest sign of possible strain in the relationship between New Delhi and Washington.

title: Thai Conservative Party Quits Ruling Coalition in Blow to PM
content: The second-largest party in Thai Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra’s government quit the ruling coalition, a major setback for the leader facing calls for resignation after blaming her own military for escalating a border dispute with neighbor Cambodia.

title: RFK Jr.’s Vaccine Panel to Vote on Flu Shots With Mercury
content: A panel of key government advisers appointed by Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. will weigh in on an infrequently used vaccine preservative that has been wrongly linked to autism in the past.

title: Trump Activates 2,000 National Guard Soldiers in Los Angeles
content: The Trump administration has deployed into duty 2,000 National Guard soldiers in California, even as the state’s governor clashes with the White House over using troops to quell protests over the federal immigration crackdown.

title: Spanish Grid Denies Network Mismanagement on Day of Blackout
content: Spanish power grid operator Red Electrica said it managed the network properly on the day of the nationwide blackout in April, clashing with the government’s opinion about the causes of the incident.

title: Iran’s Missile Attacks Wane, Allowing Israel to Start Reopening
content: Iran’s missile and drone attacks on Israel appear to be subsiding, prompting Israeli authorities to relax some safety restrictions.

title: Police Have Right to Ban Budapest Pride Event, Minister Says
content: A senior minister said Hungary’s police have the right to ban a Pride parade scheduled later this month, in response to an attempt by Budapest’s mayor to organize it under the capital’s auspices.

title: Colleges Face Major Tax Blow in Trump’s Proposed IRS Rules on Race
content: The Trump administration is privately considering unleashing what advocates and critics agree would be one of its biggest cudgels yet to pressure colleges to end slews of programs and practices benefiting students who are racial minorities.

title: Republican Who Flip-Flopped on Energy Credits Risks Voters’ Ire
content: In the weeks before the House of Representative’s vote to gut clean energy tax credits in President Donald Trump’s sweeping tax and spending bill, Virginia Congresswoman Jen Kiggans cast herself as the leading Republican champion of renewables.

title: Fertilizer Plant Set to Lose License as Trump Squeezes Venezuela
content: One of Venezuela’s most valuable overseas assets is set to lose its license to operate in Colombia as part of a US attack on the finances of the Nicolas Maduro regime.

title: UN Says It Has Lost Track of Iran’s Near-Bomb-Grade Uranium
content: The United Nations nuclear watchdog said the location of Iran’s near-bomb-grade stockpile of enriched uranium cannot currently be verified, as Israel’s ongoing military assault is preventing inspectors from doing their work.

title: Iran’s Leader Stays Defiant as Trump Weighs War Intervention
content: Iran’s Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei rejected President Donald Trump’s demands for complete capitulation and predicted “irreparable damage” if the US joins Israel in bombarding his country.

title: Orban Confronts Strongest Opposition Poll Surge of His Rule
content: Hungary’s opposition Tisza Party surged to an unprecedented 15 percentage point lead over Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s Fidesz in an opinion poll, with more voters now expecting the strongman premier to face defeat in the next elections.

title: Khamenei Tells US That Iran Won’t Surrender to Israel
content: Iran’s Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said his country won’t surrender to Israel after US President Donald Trump called for the Islamic Republic’s capitulation amid growing speculation that Washington could enter the conflict.

title: Iran-Israel Conflict Spreads to Hacks on Banks, Crypto
content: The conflict between Israel and Iran is spilling over into the digital world, inflaming a decades-long campaign of hacks and espionage between two nations renowned for their cyber prowess.

title: Trump Flexes Security Powers to Keep Global Tariff Goal Alive
content: The Trump administration is pressing ahead with another tariff barrage that some trade experts say is more legally sound than the president’s country-by-country duties and may end up having an equally broad effect on imports.

title: South Africa, US to Resume Trade Talks as Tariff Deadline Looms
content: South Africa will resume trade talks with the Trump administration on the sidelines of the US-Africa Business Summit next week, with less than a month to go before Washington’s reciprocal tariffs are set to come into effect.

title: Thai PM Sparks Turmoil After Criticizing Army in Leaked Audio
content: Thailand’s prime minister blamed her own military for escalating a border dispute with Cambodia, according to a leaked audio recording, sparking fresh political turmoil in the country as opposition groups called on her to resign.

title: Portugal Premier Gets Backing From Opposition in Parliament Vote
content: Portuguese Prime Minister Luis Montenegro’s minority government got backing from the two biggest opposition parties in a vote in parliament after his center-right coalition won a snap election in May.

title: In Tehran, Iranians Brace for What’s Next in Unpredictable War
content: With their economy on its knees and a weakened leadership, people in the capital don’t expect things to be the same again.

title: Bank Indonesia Official Summoned as Witness in Graft Case
content: A Bank Indonesia deputy governor will testify this week as a witness in a graft case related to the use of corporate social responsibility funds.

title: Russia's Faltering Oil Flows Crimp Gains From Rally in Prices
content: Crude shipments fell to the lowest since April in the four weeks to June 15

title: Brazil’s Lula to Push Fiscal Plan Forward Despite Setbacks in Congress
content: Brazil’s government has no immediate plans to develop new fiscal measures amid setbacks in Congress, and will instead seek to persuade lawmakers against blocking proposed tax increases, according to two officials with knowledge of the situation.

title: RFK Jr.’s Criticism of Fluoride Is Good News for Natural Toothpaste Brands
content: Fluoride-free toothpaste sales are jumping as Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. and other government officials openly question the safety of the mineral long hailed as a public-health miracle.

content: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.

title: Insurers Want Businesses to Wake Up to Costs of Extreme Heat
content: Today’s newsletter looks at the “invisible peril” of extreme heat and how it's becoming a growing risk to businesses worldwide. Later, read our scoop on an internal US government memo outlining ways to abolish the Federal Emergency Management Agency. For unlimited access to climate and energy news, please subscribe.

title: Amazon’s Zoox Opens Robotaxi Production Site in California
content: Amazon.com Inc.’s Zoox autonomous driving unit opened a robotaxi production facility in California in the latest move by a deep-pocketed tech company to expand the nascent industry.

title: Waymo Applies for NYC Testing Permit, Sending Uber and Lyft Shares Lower
content: Alphabet Inc.’s Waymo has applied for a permit to test its robotaxis in New York City, underscoring its intent to operate in one of the largest ride-hailing markets in the US despite an absence of local regulations supporting commercially operated autonomous vehicles.

title: Nvidia Joins $650 Million Funding for Gates-Backed Nuke Firm
content: TerraPower LLC, a nuclear startup founded by billionaire Bill Gates, raised $650 million to help continue development of an advanced reactor project under construction in Wyoming.

title: Trump Again Pushes TikTok Sale Deadline With 90-Day Reprieve
content: President Donald Trump plans to extend for a third time the deadline for Chinese company ByteDance Ltd. to divest the American operations of TikTok, allowing the social media app to keep running in the US while negotiations proceed.

title: Intel Brings in New Engineering Leaders to Help AI Comeback
content: Intel Corp. named new engineering leadership as part of a turnaround effort under Chief Executive Officer Lip-Bu Tan, tapping veterans of Cadence Design Systems Inc., Apple Inc. and Google.

title: Justices Back Temporary Texas Nuclear Waste Storage Site
content: The US Supreme Court left intact a federal plan to store as much as 40,000 tons of highly radioactive waste at a temporary site in west Texas over the objections of local landowners and oil and gas operators.

title: OpenAI Is Phasing Out Scale AI Work Following Startup’s Meta Deal
content: OpenAI is phasing out the work it does with data-labeling startup Scale AI, cutting ties with the company days after Meta Platforms Inc. invested billions of dollars in it and hired its founder.

title: Lab-Grown Meat Soon on Australia’s Menus After Approval
content: Australia has approved the sale of slaughter-free Japanese quail, becoming only the third country in the world to permit the sale of meat cultivated from animal cells.

title: Chipmaker Wolfspeed Nears Bankruptcy Deal With Lenders Including Apollo
content: Struggling chipmaker Wolfspeed Inc. will be taken over by creditors including Apollo Global Management Inc. under a proposal that would put it into bankruptcy just long enough to slash billions in debt, according to people familiar with the plan.

title: Broadcom’s 340% Rally Has Wall Street Debating If It's Magnificent Seven Material
content: For more than two years, conversations about the biggest, most important technology companies have revolved around the same seven stocks. Now, some on Wall Street are making the case that Broadcom Inc. should be part of that discussion.

title: Xreal’s One Pro Are a Stopgap Ahead of True AR Smart Glasses
content: Review: The company’s latest augmented-reality glasses excel as an external display for phones, PCs and gaming devices.

title: Tencent-Backed MiniMax Releasing AI Tools to Take On Manus
content: Chinese upstart MiniMax is slated to roll out a pair of AI products that autonomously perform tasks on behalf of users, upping its game in the realm of agentic AI against the likes of OpenAI and Manus.

title: Texas Instruments Touts Plans to Invest $60 Billion in the US
content: Texas Instruments Inc. touted plans to spend more than $60 billion on semiconductor plants in the US, making it the latest chipmaker to promote its domestic manufacturing ambitions as the Trump administration urges investments and threatens to upend the sector with tariffs.

title: Road to a $3.7 Trillion Stablecoin Market Is Full of Obstacles
content: The passage of stablecoin legislation in the US Senate marks a huge leap forward for the potential mainstreaming of cryptocurrencies that track the US dollar one-to-one.

title: SoftBank-Backed Startup Misses Financial Goals, Slashes Staff
content: Just a couple years ago, Spotter Inc. was one of the most valuable startups in the booming business of YouTube celebrity. The company, which boasted a new way for social media stars to fund their operations, fronted millions of dollars to creators like MrBeast and Dude Perfect in exchange for a share of the revenue their videos generated.

title: Iran-Israel Conflict Spreads to Hacks on Banks, Crypto
content: The conflict between Israel and Iran is spilling over into the digital world, inflaming a decades-long campaign of hacks and espionage between two nations renowned for their cyber prowess.

title: Italy’s Brembo to Provide Brakes for US Bike Brand Specialized
content: Brembo NV will supply a braking system for US bicycle brand Specialized as part of a partnership the two companies are setting up, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Ad Industry Parties at Cannes in Face of Looming AI Upheaval
content: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Benoit Berthelot reports that the ad industry continues to party as usual at the annual Cannes Lions festival in France despite underlying anxiety about the coming effects of artificial intelligence.

title: Ex-SpaceX Staffers Raise Cash for Defense Manufacturing Startup
content: Senra Systems joins a growing list of startups aiming to accelerate American manufacturing of drones, rockets and more.

title: UBS Confirms Data Stolen After Hack at External Supplier
content: UBS Group AG said that information about the company had been stolen in a cyber attack on one of its suppliers, following a report a Swiss newspaper that data on more than 130,000 employees had been subject to a hack.

title: Alibaba-Backed ‘AI Dragon’ MiniMax Is Said to Plan Hong Kong IPO
content: MiniMax is considering an initial public offering in Hong Kong, people familiar with the situation said, in what would be a landmark industry debut for a Chinese AI startup valued at about $3 billion.

title: SAP and IBM Unit Ensnared in $800 Million Quebec IT Fiasco
content: Software company SAP SE and an IBM Corp. subsidiary are embroiled in a C$1.1 billion ($810 million) technology boondoggle that triggered both a public inquiry and an anti-corruption investigation in Quebec.

title: Netflix Adds Live TV Broadcasts, Sports From France’s TF1
content: Netflix Inc. will add live television channels and shows from French broadcaster TF1, expanding the streaming platform’s live offer for customers in the country.

title: EU Says AliExpress Failed to Stop Illegal Sales in DSA Probe
content: The European Union escalated a probe against Alibaba Group Holding Ltd.’s e-commerce service AliExpress, accusing it of failing to tackle the spread of illegal products on its platform.

title: Musk’s xAI Burns Through $1 Billion a Month as Costs Pile Up
content: Elon Musk’s artificial intelligence startup xAI is burning through $1 billion a month as the cost of building its advanced AI models races ahead of the limited revenues, according to people briefed on the company’s financials.

title: Star Capital Weighs IPO of Defense Tech Firm Vincorion
content: Star Capital is considering an initial public offering of German defense technology firm Vincorion, people familiar with the matter said, as rising investor interest lifts the value in European aerospace and defense assets.

title: KKR, GIC Are Among Final Bidders for MasOrange, Zegona  Joint Venture
content: KKR & Co. and GIC Pte. are among the final bidders for a stake in a fiber-optic broadband network venture owned by MasOrange and Zegona Communications Plc, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: How China Is Building a Powerful Army of Hackers
content: On today’s Big Take Asia podcast, how China’s domestic hacking competitions are helping boost the country’s cyber-espionage capabilities.

title: JD.com Billionaire Unveils Turnaround Plan After Five-Year Slump
content: JD.com Inc. founder Richard Liu vowed to speed an overseas foray and compete with Meituan in new arenas from food delivery to travel, describing his boldest attempt yet to revive an online retailer that’s languished since a 2020 government crackdown.

title: US-China Tech Fight Widens After Taiwan Blacklists Huawei
content: Taiwan joined a yearslong US campaign to curtail China’s technological ascent when it blacklisted the country’s AI and chipmaking champions, an unprecedented step that may signal a resurgent effort to isolate its powerful neighbor’s semiconductor sector.

title: Analysis of Fed Rate Decision
content: Jerome Powell during a news conference following a Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) meeting in Washington in May. Photographer: Tierney L. Cross/Bloomberg

title: Big Spenders Have Banks Raising Prices, Perks on Premium Cards
content: Sweeter benefits — and higher fees — on travel cards from Chase and Amex reflect a new US economic reality, with the richest households driving half of all consumer spending.

title: IMF Says Zimbabwe’s Economy Has Made ‘Significant Progress’
content: The International Monetary Fund said Zimbabwe’s economic progress represents a “regime change,” but declined to say if or when the Washington-based lender would grant it a staff-monitored program.

title: ECB’s Panetta Says Economic Outlook Faces Substantial Risks
content: The euro-zone’s economic prospects face “substantial” dangers that officials are struggling to assess, according to European Central Bank Governing Council member Fabio Panetta.

title: Modi Disputes Trump’s Version of India-Pakistan Ceasefire
content: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi disputed President Donald Trump’s claims that trade deals were used to clinch a recent ceasefire with Pakistan, the latest sign of possible strain in the relationship between New Delhi and Washington.

title: Macklem Warns of Firmer Inflation, Uncertainty About Impact of Tariffs
content: Bank of Canada Governor Tiff Macklem reiterated that he sees inflation running hotter than expected, while saying employment appears to be holding up outside of trade-intensive sectors.

title: France’s Economy Is Falling Behind as Europe Gradually Recovers
content: France’s economy is falling behind the rest of Europe with weakness across the board — just as uncertainty over budget cuts looks set to return, according to the statistics office.

title: It’s Not Cool To Be a Job Creator Right Now
content: What’s really going on with the labor market?

title: UK Inheritance Tax Surge on Rich Was Mistake, Policy Author Says
content: One of the architects of the UK Labour government’s flagship crackdown on the wealthy said it was a “mistake” to expose non-doms to an immediate 40% inheritance tax on their overseas assets.

title: New Home Construction Falls to Five-Year Low
content: New US residential construction declined in May to the slowest pace since the onset of the pandemic as an elevated inventory of homes for sale and high mortgage rates sapped the motivation to build.

title: Chile Holds Rates at 5%, Leaving Timing Open on Future Cuts
content: Chile’s central bank kept its interest rate unchanged and signaled it will resume cuts in coming months as long as the economic impact from global uncertainty — including the Middle East conflict — remains limited.

title: Zimbabwe Asks South Africa to Back G-20 Debt Overhaul
content: Zimbabwe has asked South Africa to help garner support for its debt to be revamped under the Group of 20’s Common Framework, a step that could restore its access to international capital markets for the first time in more than 25 years.

title: US Jobless Claims Stabilize Near Highest Levels This Year
content: Applications for US unemployment benefits ticked down last week, stabilizing near the highest levels in eight months.

title: Euro Zone Is Still Held Back by Rising Mortgage Rates, ECB Finds
content: Household consumption in the euro area will remain restrained for some time as past interest-rate hikes continue to feed through to mortgages, according to research by the European Central Bank.

title: South Africa, US to Resume Trade Talks as Tariff Deadline Looms
content: South Africa will resume trade talks with the Trump administration on the sidelines of the US-Africa Business Summit next week, with less than a month to go before Washington’s reciprocal tariffs are set to come into effect.

title: UK Home Prices See Biggest Drop Since 2021 as Tax Hike Kicks In
content: UK home prices fell in April by most since 2021, government data show, as a tax increase drove some buyers out of the market.

title: Fed Ponders If Tariff Hit Is Less, or Just Later, Than Expected
content: I’m Chris Anstey, an economics editor in Boston and today we’re looking at the upcoming Fed policy meeting. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.

title: Trump Taps Tariff Toolkit to Hit Consumer Goods
content: With President Donald Trump’s universal tariffs possibly headed for a Supreme Court showdown, his administration is pressing ahead with another strategy that could hit an equally broad swath of imports.

title: Riksbank Cuts Key Rate and Signals Potential for More Easing
content: Sweden’s central bank lowered borrowing costs by a quarter point, resuming attempts to jump-start growth in the biggest Nordic economy, and raised the prospect of one more cut this year.

title: Norway Will Keep Waiting Before First Rate Cut
content: Norway’s central bank is poised to stick with one of the most hawkish policy stances among advanced economies, holding off on any start to post-pandemic easing until later this year.

title: Bank Indonesia Official Summoned as Witness in Graft Case
content: A Bank Indonesia deputy governor will testify this week as a witness in a graft case related to the use of corporate social responsibility funds.

title: Brazil Economists’ Shifting Calls Presage Thriller Rate Decision
content: On the eve of Brazil’s interest rate decision this week, XP’s Chief Economist Caio Megale agonized over data and policymaker speeches before switching his forecast to a hold from a quarter-point rise. Poring over the same details, ASA economist Leonardo Costa went the opposite way, ditching his bet on steady borrowing costs and calling for a hike instead.

title: Philippine Central Bank Chief Calls Peso Intervention Futile
content: The Philippines will tolerate the slide in its currency to a two-month low, with the central bank governor flagging that interventions won’t be effective in the face of global risk aversion.

title: PBOC Head Imagines New World Currency Order After Dollar Era
content: People’s Bank of China Governor Pan Gongsheng laid out in the clearest terms yet his vision for the future of a new global currency order after decades of dollar dominance, predicting a more competitive system will take root in the years to come.

title: South African Inflation Holds Steady as Conflict Clouds Outlook
content: South African inflation rate held steady in May as uncertainty around the outlook for price-growth mounts, complicating the task for the central bank when it meets to discuss its monetary policy stance next month.

title: IMF Met Emerging-Market Creditors on Debt Rework Strategies
content: A group of International Monetary Fund officials met with private creditors last week in London, as part of the multilateral lender’s work to publish a new report on sovereign debt restructurings in emerging markets, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: The US Has More Copper Than China But No Way to Refine All of It
content: The industry will need to overcome high energy and labor costs, environmental regulations and a glut of cheap Chinese competition to make US copper smelting great again.

title: Yellen, Bernanke Oppose GOP-Backed Cuts to Financial Research
content: Former Federal Reserve Chairs Janet Yellen and Ben Bernanke, along with several other academics, market participants and former Treasury officials, urged congressional leadership to oppose cuts to an office charged with gathering data aimed at preventing another financial crisis.

title: UK Inflation Holds at Highest in Over a Year Before BOE Vote
content: UK inflation remained at its highest in over a year, keeping price pressures uncomfortably strong as the Bank of England weighs how much energy market turmoil will affect its path to cutting interest rates.

title: Czech Central Banker Kubicek Sees Rate Cuts Ending on Inflation
content: The Czech central bank may have to refrain from lowering interest rates any further because sticky inflation requires restrictive monetary conditions, according to board member Jan Kubicek.

title: Amazon’s Zoox Opens Robotaxi Production Site in California
content: Amazon.com Inc.’s Zoox autonomous driving unit opened a robotaxi production facility in California in the latest move by a deep-pocketed tech company to expand the nascent industry.

title: RFK Jr. Says Starbucks CEO Pledged to Align Menu With ‘MAHA’ Movement
content: US Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. said Starbucks Corp. Chief Executive Officer Brian Niccol vowed to further align the company’s menu with the administration’s health goals.

title: Brookfield’s Insurer Trims Private Credit, Citing Crowded Trade
content: Brookfield Corp.’s insurance unit has pulled back from investments in private credit as surging demand from rival bidders pushes yields down.

title: Biggest US Oil Stockpile Drop in a Year Shows Tightening Market
content: US crude stockpiles declined the most in almost a year last week, signaling a tighter market for American oil just as the Israel-Iran conflict threatens supplies from the Middle East.

title: RFK Jr.’s New Panel Takes on Vaccine Ingredients, Shots for Kids
content: Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s plan for America’s vaccines is coming into focus, with his revamped immunization advisory panel set to discuss the use of measles shots in kids next week and vote on an ingredient that’s been wrongly linked to autism.

title: Panthers Beat Oilers 5-1 to Become Repeat Stanley Cup Champion
content: SUNRISE, Fla. (AP) — Stanley's stay in South Florida is getting extended.

title: US Plans to Ease Capital Rule Limiting Banks Treasury Trades
content: The top US bank regulators plan to reduce a key capital buffer by up to 1.5 percentage points for the biggest lenders after concerns that it constrained their trading in the $29 trillion Treasuries market.

title: UAW President Retaliated Against Union Official, Monitor Alleges
content: United Auto Workers President Shawn Fain retaliated against one of his own top lieutenants, according to a report by a court-appointed monitor assigned to watch the union’s governance after years of corruption.

title: Globalive Bid for Wealth One Bank Wins Canada Approval
content: Freedom Mobile founder Anthony Lacavera’s investment firm won federal approval to acquire Wealth One Bank of Canada.

title: Lululemon Is Cutting 150 Corporate Employees After Review
content: Lululemon Athletica Inc. is reducing its corporate headcount by about 150 jobs due to changes to the company’s organizational structure.

title: Spanish Grid Denies Network Mismanagement on Day of Blackout
content: Spanish power grid operator Red Electrica said it managed the network properly on the day of the nationwide blackout in April, clashing with the government’s opinion about the causes of the incident.

title: South Africa Plans Upgrade, Expansion of Cape Town Harbor
content: South Africa’s ports company plans an upgrade of facilities and equipment at the Cape Town harbor that should alleviate congestion and help the nation’s export-orientated agricultural sector expand its offerings overseas.

title: Houston’s Electric Utility Is Prepared for Storms After 2024 Blackout, CEO Says
content: Houston’s electric utility is confident significant grid investments will prevent a repeat of widespread blackouts that occurred last summer following Hurricane Beryl.

title: Morgan Stanley Taps ‘Specialists’ in Bid for Founders’ Wealth
content: Morgan Stanley is doubling down on its efforts to manage the wealth of founders, investors and employees of closely held companies, adding a new designation for advisers focused on the space.

title: India’s New Copper Plant Finally Starts Amid Ore Shortage
content: A new copper smelter owned by Indian billionaire Gautam Adani started processing mined ores this week after multiple delays due to a lack of feedstock, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Zimbabwe Asks South Africa to Back G-20 Debt Overhaul
content: Zimbabwe has asked South Africa to help garner support for its debt to be revamped under the Group of 20’s Common Framework, a step that could restore its access to international capital markets for the first time in more than 25 years.

title: Morgan Stanley’s Top Asia Banker Targets $10 Billion Revenue
content: Last month, as the US-China trade war heated up, Morgan Stanley’s co-President Dan Simkowitz made a discreet visit to Beijing. It was the first time a senior US executive from the bank had stepped foot in China in five years, and came days after a rare board meeting in Tokyo near the Imperial Palace.

title: Wall Street Wants In on Crumbl’s Oversized Sugary Cookies
content: On a recent afternoon on Manhattan’s Upper East Side, young patrons queued up for a TikTok-famous treat: a $5 cookie from Crumbl.

title: Victoria’s Secret Sticks Up for CEO Who Investor Says Is Failing
content: Victoria’s Secret & Co. spared no expense to lure Chief Executive Hillary Super away from Rihanna: It paid nearly $760,000 for her relocation costs, including real estate agent fees and six months of temporary housing, and more than $11,000 for personal security.

title: Mideast Oil Giants Bring Their Billions in Search of LNG Riches
content: A new breed of investors is expanding into liquefied natural gas, one of the world’s hottest commodities, offering billions of dollars for new projects and squeezing out established players.

title: Dozens of Bali Flights Canceled After Volcanic Eruption
content: Indonesia’s Bali airport saw dozens of flights canceled because of a volcanic eruption nearby, stranding holidaymakers and threatening the area’s key tourism industry.

title: RFK Jr.’s Criticism of Fluoride Is Good News for Natural Toothpaste Brands
content: Fluoride-free toothpaste sales are jumping as Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. and other government officials openly question the safety of the mineral long hailed as a public-health miracle.

title: German Lender PBB Ends Ill-Fated US Foray After a Decade
content: German commercial property lender Deutsche Pfandbriefbank AG is giving up on the US, a decade after it embarked on an expansion that ultimately proved damaging to its balance sheet.

title: HSBC Weighs Asking Staff to Show Up in Office Three Days a Week
content: HSBC Holdings Plc is considering telling all its employees to work from one of the bank’s offices at least three days a week, as it looks to tighten some of its flexible policies that have been in place since the pandemic.

title: The US Has More Copper Than China But No Way to Refine All of It
content: The industry will need to overcome high energy and labor costs, environmental regulations and a glut of cheap Chinese competition to make US copper smelting great again.

title: Renault Kicks Off CEO Search After De Meo’s Surprise Exit
content: Renault SA is under pressure to quickly find a replacement for Chief Executive Officer Luca de Meo after the shock news of his planned departure, as the industry grapples with rising trade tensions and intense competition from Chinese manufacturers led by BYD Co.

title: Finnish Insurer Sampo Picks Thorsrud as CEO to Succeed Magnusson
content: Finland’s Sampo Oyj appointed Morten Thorsrud to succeed retiring Torbjorn Magnusson as chief executive officer, in a sign of continuity at the helm of the property and casualty insurer.

title: Germany’s Defense Firms Need Steelmakers to Help Fuel Boom
content: German defense manufacturers including Rheinmetall AG are urging domestic steelmakers to ramp up production of military-grade metal, to secure their long-term ability to make armored trucks and tanks.

title: China Car Subsidy Halted in Some Areas as Funds Run Low
content: China’s trade-in subsidy to boost sales of electric and fuel-efficient vehicles has been suspended in key cities across at least six provinces as funds run short and officials scrutinize the prevalence of zero-mileage used cars.

title: London’s Sky-High Prices Thin the Ranks of Room-to-Rent Seekers
content: The number of people looking for a room to rent in London has continued to slide, data from a property search website show, in a sign that high rents are pushing even that modest goal out of reach for many residents.

title: AI Autonomous Agents Are Top 2025 Trend For Seed Investment

title: What Seed Trends Say About The Future: Live Long, Recycle And Launch More Satellites

title: A Deep Dive Into The Leading Investors In Unicorns Minted Since 2023

title: Looking Back 10 Years, Seed Investors Envisioned A Different Future Unfolding

title: Global Venture Funding Slowed In April, Despite Strong AI Showing

title: Europe’s VC Funding Stayed Flat In Q1, Even As Healthcare Added A Third
content: Europe’s venture funding plateaued at $12.6 billion in Q1 2025 — flat quarter over quarter and year over year, Crunchbase data shows. Without the sort of outsized AI funding rounds seen in North America in the first quarter, the continent’s share of global funding also fell.

title: Latin America Startup Funding Fell Sequentially In Q1
content: Latin America startup investment declined sequentially in the first quarter of this year, driven by a drop in later-stage dealmaking. Even so, funding was above the depressed levels seen a year ago, and early-stage dealmaking showed signs of strength.

title: SignalFire Closes On $1B To Invest In Applied AI

title: North America Startup Investment Spiked In Q1 Due To OpenAI, But Seed And Early Stage Fell
